question: What are my options for refinancing my current mortgage at an interest rate of 3.5%?
true_answer: You can refinance to lower your rate, shorten your loan term, or take cash out. Current rates can be compared for better savings.

steps.content: What are my options for refinancing my current mortgage at an interest rate of 3.5%?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for refinance options. 2) Involve credit_agent for credit impact. 3) Use calculator to estimate new payments. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Refinancing options include rate-and-term refinance, cash-out refinance, and streamline refinance.
Checking impact of refinancing on credit score.
Refinancing may temporarily lower your credit score due to a hard inquiry but can improve over time by lowering your debt.
Can refinancing help me pay off my mortgage faster?
Retrieving knowledge for refinancing to shorten loan term.
Yes, refinancing to a shorter term can help pay off your mortgage faster with potentially lower interest rates.
Calculating estimated payments for a 15-year term vs. 30-year term.
Payment for 15-year term calculated at $1,200/month, 30-year at $900/month.
Review complete, all refinancing options and calculations verified.
You can refinance to reduce your rate, shorten your term, or take cash out. Shortening to 15-year term helps pay faster, with higher monthly payments.
Let us know if you need further assistance or details on specific rates.
